channel.title: Comments on: Daniel Landes responds to Arthur Green’s response.
channel.description: notes on Jewish theology and spirituality

item.title: By: Michael
item.dc:creator: Michael
item.description: The discussion is foolish if it's any more than academic. Why do we continue to speak about God as if we were describing an existence that has the reality of a natural entity? What God are we talking about: the one proven by the cosmological argument? the ontological argument? the argument from design? the teleological argument? etc, etc. Better to be a truly radical mystic and say nothing about the divine.

item.title: By: Steven
item.dc:creator: Steven
item.description: You are, I think, too quick to take offense. Landes did not "call Green unsophisticated." Rather, he said in passing that a rhetorical image chosen by Green was not scientifically well-founded. Landes may be right or wrong but he was not displaying "nerve." To the contrary, the tone of his response seemed quite conciliatory. Thanks for flagging this interesting exchange.
